tool.name: cellranger count
tool.description: takes FASTQ files from cellranger mkfastq and performs alignment, filtering, barcode counting, and UMI counting
tool.command: mkdir ./fastq_dir && ln -s $input_fastq1 ./fastq_dir/fastq_R1.fastq.gz && ln -s $input_fastq2 ./fastq_dir/fastq_R1.fastq.gz && /cvmfs/soft.galaxy/v2.1/server/tools/florian/bin/cellranger-3.1.0/cellranger count --id $id --fastqs ./fastq_dir #if str($refGenomeSource.genomeSource) == 'indexed'; --transcriptome ${refGenomeSource.index.fields.path} #else --transcriptome ${refGenomeSource.transcriptome.extra_files_path} #end if --sample $sample --expect-cells $expect_cells --chemistry $chemistry --output-dir $output.extra_files_path --metric $metric --hdf5 $hdf5 --mhdf5 $mhdf5

param.name: id
param.label: A unique run ID string: e.g. sample345 (--id)

param.name: input_fastq1
param.label: Read 1 file for scRNA-seq dataset containing barcode information. (.fastq/.fastq.gz)

param.name: input_fastq2
param.label: Read 2 file for scRNA-seq dataset containing cDNA information. (.fastq/.fastq.gz)

param.help: Built-ins were indexed using default options
param.label: Will you select a reference genome from your history or use a built-in index?
param.name: genomeSource
transcriptome
param.label: Path to the Cell Ranger compatible transcriptome reference (--transcriptome)

param.name: sample
param.label: sample (--sample)
param.help: Sample name as specified in the sample sheet supplied to cellranger mkfastq. Can take multiple comma-separated values
